p: SARS was an epidemic disease caused by a coronavirus very similar to COVID‐19 virus, which affected the world between 2002 and 2003, causing hundreds of deaths (Wilder‐Smith, Chiew, & Lee, 2020). Experimental studies on the following years after the epidemic pointed out that NHP developed, in general, lighter versions of the symptoms than those detected in humans (Lawler, Endy, & Hensley, 2006). The animals normally presented pneumonia that peaked about 10 days after inoculation, with detectable pulmonary changes until 60 days, even though there were no meaningful changes in the rest of the laboratory tests.
